subject: Productivity
title: Reward Timing and Motivation
description: A quick, practical guide to Reward Timing and Motivation.

hook.text: A reward delayed by even a few seconds loses most of its motivating power. Timing is everything.

buildup.text: Behavioral research shows that immediate rewards strengthen behavior far more effectively than delayed ones.

discovery.text: This is why annual bonuses barely motivate daily behavior. The gap between action and reward is too wide.

twist.text: Small, frequent rewards beat large, rare ones. A daily checkmark motivates more than a yearly promotion.

climax.text: The best motivation systems deliver quick feedback loops. Video games, fitness apps, and habit trackers all use this.

punchline.text: Reward immediately. Reward often. That's how behavior sticks.

quiz.question: Why do annual bonuses poorly motivate daily behavior?
options: The gap between action and reward is too wide
The bonus amount is always too small
Workers don't understand the bonus structure
